name: NPR
text:
Six states have joined forces to buy 3 million coronavirus tests to address "severe testing shortages and delays" that have hamstrung the nation's response to the pandemic.
https://t.co/RT2jgH2yWT

name: NPR
text:
Here are some of an expert's tips for navigating public disagreements about pandemic safety:
‚úÖ Show mutual consideration
‚úÖ Take steps to protect yourself
‚úÖ Let go of actions that don't affect you
Get the rest, and a printable pocket guide, here: https://t.co/Khp6PN9Tzc

name: NPR
text:
Congrats, Linda Diaz! The New York singer-songwriter is the winner of the 2020 Tiny Desk Contest. 

Watch @lindadiazmusic's winning entry, ‚ÄúGreen Tea Ice Cream,‚Äù and see why it stood out among more than 6,000 entries. https://t.co/uVAXbngBeD

name: NPR
text:
For the first time, scientists have identified an aggressive bone cancer in a dinosaur. It was found in the leg bone of a plant-eating Centrosaurus apertus that lived 76 to 77 million years ago.
https://t.co/NbaRJ3Kr2C

name: NPR
text:
Follow along for live results from primaries in Arizona, Michigan, Missouri and Washington state:
https://t.co/ZeyOHArFsA

name: NPR
text: In her new book, Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist Isabel Wilkerson examines the laws and practices that created a bipolar caste system in the U.S. ‚Äî and how the Nazis borrowed from it. https://t.co/ivyyL0paqD

name: NPR
text:
The Trump Administration's new suicide prevention strategy mentions the touchy subject of gun-safety. 

Gun owners are four times more likely to die by suicide, but keeping guns away from veterans has become politically radioactive. https://t.co/JW4iU3hFFB

name: NPR
text: Cori Bush, a nurse and Black Lives Matter Activist, is projected by the AP to win a Democratic primary in Missouri, ousting William Lacy Clay, a longtime incumbent. Clay, who succeeded his father, has represented the 1st District since 2001. https://t.co/zfBskFujBO

name: NPR
text: In "Lemonade," Knowles drew on the symbolism of water to signify rebirth and renewal in her marriage. In "Black Is King," she graduates from the sea to the stars, imagining a world in which Blackness and Black people are unconstrained, writes Cate Young. https://t.co/OaT8lqmP5G

name: NPR
text:
Singer-songwriter Ondara (@spanishvillager) wrote and recorded his second album entirely during the pandemic shutdown ‚Äî and it sounds like it.

‚ÄúTales From Isolation‚Äù touches on the anxieties many experienced during that time. https://t.co/lfbYzbyikx

name: NPR
text:
Like so many artists, @katedavismusic is marking time by writing new music. 

Watch her perform one of those new tunes, "Ride or Die," for this quarantine concert. üëá https://t.co/hhEbuAagOV

name: NPR
text:
The musical tastes of the NPR Music crew are a delightful jumble. 

@mkenneymusic, @nubya_garcia, @schneidermaria and @taylorswift13 make their list of favorite music released in July. https://t.co/MfADSZcVya

name: NPR
text:
For more than a century, food has been getting more abundant ‚Äî and cheaper. And yet people keep worrying about shortages. 

Some economists say the fears actually create their own problems.
https://t.co/O329UhLfwo

name: NPR
text: As the start of the school year approaches, a growing number of parents are looking at alternatives to distance learning through public schools, including sharing a private tutor or taking the full responsibility as an at-home teacher. (@WBEZ) https://t.co/vNVKo6WzPf

name: NPR
text:
Scientists have determined that most of the large, outer stones of Stonehenge originated about 15 miles from where the prehistoric monument stands ‚Äî clearing up a centuries-long mystery about their origin.
https://t.co/WlspGEZL8A

name: NPR
text: Composer Max Richter's new album draws inspiration from the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, a document spearheaded by Eleanor Roosevelt which he calls "a blueprint for a better world." https://t.co/w1BP9oJvxQ

name: NPR
text:
The Newport Jazz Festival was in full, glorious stride during the 1960s. 

üé∂ Hear rare sets from Ray Charles, Cannonball Adderley, Sarah Vaughan, Duke Ellington and Louis Armstrong on this special episode of @jazznight. https://t.co/9W00qu2DzJ

name: NPR
text: Dead people aren't the only ones who mistakenly received $1,200 stimulus checks. So did thousands of foreign workers who entered the U.S. on temporary work visas and are now living overseas. https://t.co/iHV4pbfd8l

name: NPR
text:
Joe Biden says if elected, he wouldn't tear down the parts of the barrier built along the southern border during the Trump administration ‚Äî but that his administration wouldn't construct "another foot of wall."
 https://t.co/T0zfIlvRmn

name: NPR
text:
In an unusual partnership, entities including Comedy Central, the Fair Elections Center and Patagonia are recruiting poll workers. 

It's one effort to try to avoid a massive shortage as older folks opt out of their usual service over coronavirus concerns.
https://t.co/R5Zl6O22Qk

name: NPR
text:
What happens if a president contests an election? 

Former government and military officials held a "war game" that considered the consequences. 

More from @OnPointRadio: https://t.co/LNTMGP6aLm

name: NPR
text:
Joe Biden will be accepting the Democratic nomination from his home state of Delaware rather than traveling to Milwaukee for the DNC, officials say ‚Äî citing the worsening coronavirus pandemic.
https://t.co/0bm0B5yhc0

name: NPR
text:
Joe Biden says he would stop border wall construction if he‚Äôs elected president.

NPR‚Äôs Lulu Garcia-Navarro spoke w‚Ä¶ https://t.co/aQ38MPGipv

name: NPR
text:
In the deadly 1995 Oklahoma City bombing, two tons of ammonium nitrate was used. Beirut's port area was holding an estimated 2,750 tons.

An essential question looms over the investigation into that stockpile: Why was it there?
https://t.co/EkocHecqaC

name: NPR
text: RT @nprmusic: This week's Viking's Choice playlist also features Flo Milli, who @totalvibration says is "a dang delight." Hear Lars Gotrich's weekly playlist now. https://t.co/Xgh9CKDO9A https://t.co/rWfDhwdgsM

name: NPR
text:
Iowa Gov. Kim Reynolds has signed an executive order restoring voting rights to people with felony convictions ahead of the November election.
https://t.co/qF5w8s1ZdP

name: NPR
text:
There will be new checkpoints at New York City‚Äôs major bridges, tunnels and other sites to track travelers from COVID-19 hotspot states and enforce a 14-day quarantine. 
https://t.co/oUmoQknc2E

name: NPR
text:
The former Atlanta police officer charged with killing Rayshard Brooks has filed a lawsuit, saying his use of deadly force was justifiable and his firing has turned him into a ‚Äúpublic spectacle.‚Äù 
https://t.co/to7EHr2Hjq

name: NPR
text:
The nation's largest public university system has a new graduation requirement: students must take an ethnic studies or social justice course.

But ethnic studies might not even exist if it weren't for a group of students who went on strike 50 years ago.
https://t.co/y16qjkyAIi

name: NPR
text: UConn has canceled its football program for the 2020 season ‚Äî becoming the first FBS team to not play due to coronavirus concerns. https://t.co/iXA3JHHk5i

name: NPR
text:
A high-school dropout and former newspaper delivery boy from Brooklyn, Pete Hamill covered everything from the civil rights movement to 9/11, wrote for most of his day's leading magazines and authored 20 books.

He has died at 85.
 https://t.co/hV1txsXDYo

name: NPR
text: Kris Kobach's Senate primary loss in Kansas delivered a victory of sorts to Republicans who feared that a win for the divisive Trump ally would risk losing a seat to Democrats ‚Äî and the party‚Äôs Senate majority in November. https://t.co/62u2CptPNg

name: NPR
text:
The trombonist Helen Jones Woods, who played with the history-making all-female band, International Sweethearts of Rhythm, that toured widely during WWII, died of COVID-19 on July 25. She was 96.
https://t.co/xM1mR4CIAz

name: NPR
text:
RT @npratc: The coronavirus continues to move throughout the U.S. nearly six months since the pandemic began. Today on¬†#NPRConsiderThis, we look into the behavior that is causing current spikes.
https://t.co/ZCQeFWrrvo

name: NPR
text:
If groundbreakers like the Ramones showed that pop and punk weren't mortal enemies, the Go-Go's showed how the two styles could merge to land at the top of the charts. 

"You can take the girl out of punk, but you can't take punk out of the girl."
https://t.co/CJeDreI9si
